title: Phantom Limbs
lyrics:
You go missing like phantom limbs
You're chasing down the sunset setting in the western hills
You say you’re righting your wrongs, run and slam the car door
Tell me what is there to do now?
Sleeping light and praying for your wrists now

You’re just handwriting on the fridge now

Say I won’t get sentimental but lose myself and maybe I’m wrong



Sun comes every night

I lose myself and maybe I’m wrong

We dance like someone died

Then lose ourselves and maybe you’re gone



You need to get prescriptions filled

You stay in your apartment, I call but you don’t say shit

Tell me that you need me, shaking and you don’t sleep



Tell me what I’m supposed to do now

You get high, I wait until you come down

I watched you fall into yourself now

And now I wait till you fall back out

Wait till you fall back out



Sun comes every night

I lose myself and maybe I’m wrong

We dance like someone died

Then lose ourselves and maybe you’re gone



And don’t come running to the city when I fall

Cause I’m nothing if there’s nothing here at all

Come running to the city when I fall

‘Cause I’m nothing



The sun comes every night

I lose myself and maybe I’m wrong

We dance like someone died

Then lose ourselves and maybe you’re gone

And don’t come running to the city when I fall

'Cause I’m nothing if there’s nothing here at all

And come running to the city when I fall

‘Cause I’m nothing



You go missing like phantom limbs
